p: Only Egypt 7, 66 and Pakistan 11, 12 had HCV serologic measures based on nationally representative population‐based surveys. Pooled estimates for the risk of having been exposed to HCV using these data were 8.0% (95% CI, 6.1‐9.8) for Egypt and 4.9% (95% CI, 4.7‐5.1) for Pakistan. The corresponding numbers needed to be tested were 16.9 (95% CI, 13.6‐21.7) for Egypt and 27.3 (95% CI, 26.3‐28.5) for Pakistan. These estimates are similar to those generated using the totality of the evidence (Tables 2 and 3).
